statements: UPDATE student_grades SET grade = 85, student_name = 'Alice' WHERE student_id = 101;
UPDATE student_grades SET performance_metrics = '{"attendance": 95, "assignments": 88}' WHERE student_id = 102;
UPDATE student_grades SET grade = 85, performance_metrics = '{"attendance": "95%", "homework": "A"}' WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE student_grades SET student_name = 'John Doe', performance_metrics = '{"attendance": "90%", "homework": "B"}' WHERE student_id = 2;
UPDATE students SET grade_level = 10 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE grades SET grade = 85.50 WHERE grade_id = 3;
UPDATE students SET student_name = 'John Doe', grade_level = 10 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE grades SET grade = 95.50 WHERE student_id = 1 AND subject = 'Math';
UPDATE Students SET age = 20 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE Courses SET instructor = 'John Doe', credits = 4 WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE Students SET age = 20, grade_level = 10 WHERE student_id = 12345;
UPDATE Grades SET grade = 95 WHERE student_id = 12345 AND course_id = 56789;
UPDATE student SET grade = 10 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE exam SET exam_date = '2022-12-31' WHERE exam_id = 3;
UPDATE student SET grade = 10 WHERE student_name = 'Alice';
UPDATE exam SET exam_date = '2022-12-31' WHERE exam_name = 'Final Exam';
UPDATE students SET first_name='John', last_name='Doe' WHERE student_id=1;
UPDATE courses SET instructor='Jane Smith', credit_hours=3 WHERE course_id=101;
UPDATE students SET email='new_student1@example.com', last_name='Doe', first_name='John' WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE enrollments SET enrollment_date='2022-10-01', course_id=2 WHERE student_id = 3;
